Otonomo’s vehicle data marketplace helps automakers build their connected vehicles ecosystem
An exciting revolutionary awesome loads of  superlatives startup is looking for $position in $extremely_horrible_city_no_one_would_ever_live_in!
Working just like the early days of the industrial revolution isn't revolutionary, it's a horrible way to treat your employees and just downright sad.

The fact that they're limiting themselves to a specific city, big or small, tells me they're not interested in hiring the best engineers possible but are more interested in micro-managing the low quality employees that would live in those cities or apply for these jobs.
So of course I wouldn't work for them, but who the hell invests in those companies or believes in them other than their CEO?!?!
Consultants from McKinsey and Accenture can’t save your company
Applied Algorithmic Research, its productization, incubation of new technologies, methodologies and their standartization in F5's PD Security.

Consulting services:* Applied Mathematics* Custom Data Structures and Algorithms* Software and Systems Design * Data Science: Predictive Analytics and Statistical Inference, Machine Learning, Data and Process Mining, Anomaly Detection* Experimentation Design * Natural Language Processing* Recommender Systems (July 2013 -- Present) -- Not during my employment at Outbrain.* Algorithms and Paradigms in (Cyber) Security defense (July 2010-June 2013) -- Not during my employment at F5.* User Behavioral Analysis, Cross Device Identification* AdTech, Recommendation Algorithms, Campaign Optimization, predictive analytics, Video, RTB* Mathematical Education* Web Scale Distributed Algorithmic Engines* On-Prem Architecture, Cloud Architecture, Fog Architecture and Hybrid architectures* Time Series Analysis, Spatial Analysis, Spatial-Temporal Data Mining, GiSConsultancy services since 2010. From 2017 via mathematic.ai.

Providing mathematical education for children in all ages as well as pro bono math teaching in public schools and in community centers. In parallel, providing workshops for parents to pre-school and k12 kids on how to explain mathematical concepts, ideas and procedures to their children and how to help them become independent learners.  Escorting math teaching teams at schools.

Productization of Algorithmic Research work as a new Cyber Security product."A startup in the corporate".High velocity applied algorithmic research feeding productization in aggressive time-to-market constraints.
Applied Researcher and Head of Algorithmic Research

Applied algorithmic research, architecture and inbound product management for algorithmic engines for network and (network and web application) security oriented products and features. For example: in PEM, in ASM, in AFM, WebSafe and on futuristic new ones.In parallel to providing roadmap, product management and algorithmic research services, I am leading a team of architects and applied researchers.Applied research. Hands-on: roughly, 50% of my time is dedicated to algorithm design and analysis, architecture and software development, and the remainder 50% is used to drive my research deliverables and an excellent group of people towards rapid productization under extreme time-to-market constraints.End-to-end: from problem definition to a money making deliverable.Machine Learning, Data Structures and Algorithms, High Performance and Small Footprint Software Systems and Services, Predictive Analytics, Statistical Inference, Distributed Reinforcement Learning. Distributed Systems. Cloud Computing. Statistical Analysis. Behavioral Analysis. Cyber Secutiry. Compilation Methods. Web Scale. Data Science. Experiments Design.Perl, Python, R, Julia, Matlab/Octave, C, JavaI design and develop strategies for (distributed) machine learning approaches to solving hard problems while mentoring R&D teams towards productization of resulting solutions. Enabling F5 to make sense and money from lots (and lots) of data.* Data mining alert databases for extraction of insights* RAN QoE from subscriber's perspective for tower utilization purposes* Individual Server and Service Health predictive methods based on live analysis of ADC traffic* Mixtures of Experts and strategies for information and for classification fusion under severe uncertainty* Classification of encrypted traffic and its productization* Anomaly Detection as a Service* Seasonality Detection as a Service* Signal correlations and causality as a service* UBA and UEBA* Security Analytics...

I had the privilege and honor to work as Shlomo's team member in F5.By far, Shlomo is the best manager I've worked under. Always smiling, attentive, thorough and very open to criticism. Shlomo is one of the few people I know, that will happily change their minds given the proper facts. Always a keen learner, relentlessly curious, doing well above and beyond what's expected of him - and then some.Shlomo is honest, to the point and has a strong drive to be involved in any aspect involving the product he develops, regardless of his official job description.If you are looking for a manager with a can-do, get-things-done, focused attitude - Shlomo is definitely your man for the job.

Maydan Wienreb
Group Lead at F5 Networks
August 29, 2017, Maydan reported directly to Shlomo

I was working with Shlomo at F5 for more than 3 years.During this time Shlomo was my manager and much more, he was also a friend and coach, always candid, empowering, supporting and at the same time challenging. Shlomo has always led by self-example taking challenges upon himself and being candid on his successes and failures and never doing the same mistake twice, thus showing his values in day to day actions. Working side by side with him was a pleasure and seeing him (repeatedly) tackle situations where everyone lost their objectiveness calmly and matter-of-factly was inspiring. As a manager of our applied research team Shlomo formed a strong team with diverse capabilities and was always involved, contributing with his rapid comprehension of new ideas and deep understanding in algorithms and technology.As we made a spin-off and created a “startup” inside F5, Shlomo’s energy and passion were priceless. Shlomo draw in the best engineers in the market and formed a team out of them. He represented the new product and group extremely well, over time and across a wide range of audiences. He successfully got buy-in and cooperation from management, other groups inside F5 and costumers who were willing to experiment with us. Shlomo is a visionary while being result oriented and he is certainly the person I would like to take as partner to build a startup with one day, as I have a complete trust in his ability, integrity and passion.

Michael Kapelevich
Sr. Software Architect
August 26, 2017, Michael reported directly to Shlomo

I had the privilege of reporting to Shlomo at F5 as a member of the Algorithmic Research Team. Shlomo is an entrepreneur, a visionary, a researcher, a product manager, an architect and a development manager at the same time. He can start with a product idea, achieve management buy-in, define a product road-map, develop an initial prototype, hire a strong team of developers and execute the road-map. At F5 Shlomo lead several products and initiatives, some of them are: the Behavioral Anti-DDoS and the Risk Engine products, and the creation of the Algorithmic Research Team. Shlomo has authored multiple patented inventions at F5 and helped others to patent their ideas as well. Shlomo is an empowering manager constantly supporting his team members.  I owe a lot of my progress at F5 to Shlomo. He is a true leader inspiring by actions and positive energy. I had a great time working in his team.Shlomo can take any organization forward. I highly recommend his work.

I was privlidged to recruite Michael and to manage him at F5 in my Algorithmic Research Team. Michael is one of the rare people who is hands on, very good at the big picture architecture as well as in the details of implementation while keeping things practical operationally and business wise. I consider Michael to be a consistent over achiever and have found a lot of value in his work. summary: Skilled and experienced Algorithms and Software Engineer with over 18 years of full time research and development in the industry and in the academia.Hands on research and rapid productization director at F5 Networks, experienced in forming development teams, research teams and R&D groups from scratch into a synchronized unit that delivers high quality software deliverables.Ability to conduct independent research and development as well as leading or participating in a research and development group.Quantitive and qualitative applied research: analysis and synthesis.A technical leader and a knowledge focal point.A problem solver experienced in receiving technical and business challenges and creating infrastructural solutions to turn these requirements and problems into money-making features and products.An experienced mathematics teacher: transforming complex and hard-to-understand ideas, concepts and information into accessible and intuitive easy-to-work with tools and thinking processes to people from pre-school kids to parents and teachers.Algorithms design and analysis.Machine Learning. Statistical Inference. Predictive Analytics. Big Data. Data Mining. Cyber Security. Recommender Systems. Ad Tech, Medical, IoT.I frequently provide consulting services in my areas of expertise.Specialties: Natural Language Processing; Formal Language processing; Text Processing; Text Algorithms; String Algorithms; Graph Algorithms; Distributed Algorithms; Finite-State Automata; Data Mining; Machine Learning; Compiler and Parser Technologies; Compilation Methods; Ad Fraud Detection and Prevention; Internet protocols; Networking; Cyber Security; Time Series Analysis, Spatial Analysis, Spatio-Temporal Data Mining, Perl, C, Java, R, MATLAB, Octave.
name: Shlomo Yona
title: ‎Interdisciplinary Applied Algorithmic Research and its productization: Cyber Security,GiS, AdTech,NLP,Medical,IoT
